text: There's a species of jellyfish that's biologically immortal and can revert to its juvenile form indefinitely.
Bananas are berries, but strawberries aren't — botanically, a berry must come from a single-ovary flower.
A single sneeze travels at about 100 mph and can spread 100,000 germs.
Hot water freezes faster than cold water under certain conditions — this is called the Mpemba effect and still isn't fully understood.
There are more possible games of chess than atoms in the observable universe.
Wombat poop is cube-shaped to prevent it from rolling away, marking their territory.
Sloths can hold their breath longer than dolphins — up to 40 minutes by slowing their heart rate.
A group of crows is called a 'murder' and a group of flamingos is called a 'flamboyance.'
Scotland's national animal is the unicorn.
Cleopatra lived closer in time to the Moon landing than to the building of the Great Pyramid.
Oxford University is older than the Aztec Empire.
If you could drive to space at 60 mph, you'd get there in about an hour.
There's a basketball court on the top floor of the Supreme Court building — it's called 'the highest court in the land.'
Honey bees can be trained to detect explosives and have been used for landmine detection.
The average cloud weighs 1.1 million pounds.
There are more fake flamingos in the world than real ones.
Armadillos always give birth to identical quadruplets.
A group of porcupines is called a 'prickle.'
It would take 1.2 million mosquitoes, all sucking at once, to drain the blood from a human.
Cows have best friends and become stressed when separated.
The inventor of the frisbee was turned into a frisbee after death — his ashes were molded into memorial discs.
A day on Mercury is longer than its year — it takes 59 Earth days to rotate but only 88 to orbit the Sun.
The total weight of all ants on Earth roughly equals the total weight of all humans.
Dolphins can stay awake for 15 days straight by sleeping with only half their brain at a time.
A cat's purr vibrates at a frequency that can promote bone healing and reduce pain.
The shortest war in history lasted 38 minutes — between Britain and Zanzibar in 1896.
The word 'nerd' was first coined by Dr. Seuss in 'If I Ran the Zoo' in 1950.
Koalas have fingerprints so similar to humans' that they've confused crime scene investigators.
There are more trees on Earth than stars in the Milky Way — about 3 trillion trees.
Saudi Arabia imports camels from Australia.
The longest hiccuping spree lasted 68 years — Charles Osborne hiccuped from 1922 to 1990.
Rats laugh when tickled — they make ultrasonic chirps that are too high for humans to hear.
The moon has moonquakes, and some of them can last up to an hour.
Crows can not only recognize human faces but also tell other crows about people they don't like.
The Hawaiian alphabet has only 12 letters.
The first person convicted of speeding was going 8 mph in a 2 mph zone in 1896.
Astronauts cannot cry in space because tears don't fall — they form floating blobs on the face.
A jiffy is an actual unit of time — 1/100th of a second.
The inventor of the Pringles can is buried in one, as per his request.
Otters hold hands while sleeping so they don't drift apart.
The first computer mouse was made of wood.
Honey never spoils — 3,000-year-old honey from Egyptian tombs was still edible.
Octopuses have three hearts and blue blood.
The longest English word without a vowel is 'rhythms.'
A 'moment' was a medieval unit of time equal to 90 seconds.
Cows kill more people per year than sharks.
The dot over the letters 'i' and 'j' is called a 'tittle.'
Russia has more surface area than Pluto.
The longest time between twins being born is 87 days.
Dolphins have names for each other and will respond when called.
